meanings.definition: The amount of time during which a radio or television station is broadcasting.
meanings.sent1: The radio show had limited airtime, so they had to make every minute count.
meanings.sent2: I missed the news because I didn't catch the airtime of the broadcast.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit about running out of airtime on live TV had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her voice filled the airtime like a soothing melody, calming the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The airtime for the commercial was short, but it left a lasting impression on the viewers.

meanings.definition: The time for which a mobile phone call is charged.
meanings.sent1: I need to buy more airtime for my phone to make calls.
meanings.sent2: Her airtime ran out in the middle of our conversation, cutting us off abruptly.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting to top up his airtime, he found himself unable to make any calls.
meanings.sent4: His airtime was like a ticking clock, reminding him of the limited talk time left.
meanings.sent5: The airtime on his phone was precious, allowing him to stay connected with loved ones.
